question: Question_05_(c)
statement:
Consider an internet with six sites. The stochastic matrix describing
the behaviour of a web surfer (with damping factor zero) is

\[P = \begin{bmatrix}
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
\frac12 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 \\
\frac12 & \frac13 & 0 & 0 & \frac12 & 0 \\
0 & \frac13 & 0 & 1 & 0 & \frac12 \\
0 & 0 & \frac13 & 0 & \frac12 & 0
\end{bmatrix}\]

\textbf{(c)} Introduce a damping factor of 1/2 so that the surfer now
moves according to the stochastic matrix \emph{(1/2)P + (1/2)Q} where
\emph{Q} is the stochastic matrix describing a surfer picking any site
at random (including the current site). Beginning equal probabilities of
being at each site, what are the probabilities of being at each site
after one step?
